contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "For they slaughtered you" or "For people killed you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For you were slaughtered

contextId.information: This kind of crown was a likeness of wreaths of olive branches or laurel leaves, probably hammered out in gold. Examples actually made of leaves were given to victorious athletes to wear on their heads. This can be translated with an active verb. AT: "he received a crown" or "God gave him a crown (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was given a crown

contextId.information: This can be stated with an active verb. AT: "God gave permission to its rider" or "Its rider received person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: To its rider was given permission

contextId.information: This can be translated with an active verb. AT "those whom others had killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who had been killed

contextId.information: This can be stated with an active verb. AT: "those whom God's angel marked"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who were sealed

contextId.information: They were each given one trumpet. This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) "God gave them seven trumpets" or 2) "the Lamb gave them seven trumpets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: seven trumpets were given to them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The angel threw the hail and fire mixed with blood down onto the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It was thrown down onto the earth

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the angel threw something like a great mountain burning with fire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: something like a great mountain burning with fire was thrown

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "because the three angels who have not yet sounded their trumpets are about to sound them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: because of the remaining trumpet ... angels

contextId.information: This can be stated with an active form. AT: "The angel released the four angels who had been prepared for ... that year" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The four angels who had been prepared for ... that year, were released

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will accomplish his mystery" or "God will complete his secret plan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the mystery of God will be accomplished

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone gave me a reed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A reed was given to me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I saw the ark of his covenant in his temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the ark of his covenant was seen within his temple

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "A great sign appeared in heaven" or "I, John, saw a great sign in heaven" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A great sign was seen in heaven

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God threw the great dragon and his angels out of heaven and sent them to the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The great dragon ... was thrown down to the earth ... and his angels were thrown down with him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the dragon realized that God had thrown him out of heaven and sent him to earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the dragon realized he had been thrown down to the earth

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "But that wound healed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: but its fatal wound was healed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God gave the beast ... God permitted the beast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The beast was given ... It was permitted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God gave authority to the beast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: authority was given to it

contextId.information: This phrase clarifies who on the earth will worship the beast. It can be stated in active form. AT: "those whose names the Lamb did not write ... in The Book of Life" or "those whose names were not ... in The Book of Life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: everyone whose name was not written ... in The Book of Life

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. The noun "captivity" can be stated with the verb "capture."  AT: "If it is God's will for the enemy to capture a certain person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: If anyone is to be taken into captivity

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If it is God's will for the enemy to kill a certain person with a sword" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If anyone is to be killed with a sword

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the enemy will kill him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he will be killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the one who had a lethal wound that healed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the one whose lethal wound had been healed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God permitted the beast from the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It was permitted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "on whose foreheads the Lamb and his Father had written their names" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who had his name and his Father's name written on their foreheads

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for these plagues will complete the wrath of God." Possible meanings are 1) these plagues will show all of God's anger or 2) after these plagues, God will no longer be angry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: for with them the wrath of God will be completed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you have made everyone know about your righteous deeds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: your righteous deeds have been revealed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The extreme heat burned them badly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They were scorched by the terrible heat

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the place that people call" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the place that is called

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The earthquake split the great city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The great city was split

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "those whose names God did not write" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those whose names have not been written

contextId.information: This refers to one group of people. "Called" and "chosen" can be expressed in active form. AT: "the called, chosen, and faithful ones" or "the ones whom God has called and chosen and who are faithful to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the called ones, the chosen ones, and the faithful ones

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "until God fulfills what he said will happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: until God's words are fulfilled

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and adorned herself with gold" or "and adorned themselves with gold" or "and wore gold" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and was adorned with gold

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "who sat on the throne" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who was seated on the throne

contextId.information: You can state this in active form. AT: "the people whom God invites" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who are invited

contextId.information: You can state this in active form. AT: "Someone has written a name on him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He has a name written on him

contextId.information: You can state this in an active form. AT: "Blood had covered his robe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He wears a robe that was dipped in blood

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The rider on the white horse captured the beast and the false prophet" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The beast was captured and with him the false prophet

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God threw the beast and the false prophet alive" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The two of them were thrown alive

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The rider of the horse killed the remainder of the beast's armies with the sword that extended from his mouth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The rest of them were killed by the sword that came out of the mouth of the one who rode on the horse

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will command the angel to free him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he must be set free

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom God had given authority to judge" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who had been given authority to judge

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will release Satan from his prison" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Satan will be released from his prison

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God threw the devil who had deceived them" or "God's angel threw the devil, who had deceived them," (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The devil, who deceived them, was thrown

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "where he had also thrown the beast and the false prophet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: where the beast and the false prophet had been thrown

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone opened the books" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the books were opened

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "by what he had recorded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: by what was recorded

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the angel threw him into the lake of fire" or "the angel threw him into the place where fire burns forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was thrown into the lake of fire

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone had written" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: were written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone had built the wall with jasper and the city with pure gold" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The wall was built of jasper and the city of pure gold

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone adorned the foundations of the wall" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The foundations of the wall were adorned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which I have written about in this book" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that are written about in this book
